frontmatter.titlepage:
National and State Agricultural Publications, 1917-1994
A Collection in
Special Collections Ms2011-022
Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University 2011 &contact;
Processed by: Kira A. Dietz, Acquisitions and Processing Archivist,
Special Collections

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The collection contains more than 70 United States Department of Agriculture and Virginia Cooperative Extension publications. In addition, the collection contains several publication from agencies in Oregon and Ohio, as well as from the Virginia Emergency Relief Administration and the War Food Administration.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from National and State Agricultural Publications must be obtained from the copyright holders.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: National and State Agricultural Publications, Ms2011-022, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The original donation was acquired by Special Collections prior to 2009. Additional publications were donated to Special Collections in 2010 and were integrated with existing materials.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the National and State Agricultural Publications was completed in March 2011.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains more than 70 United States Department of Agriculture and Virginia Cooperative Extension publications on topics ranging from war-time food use and Victory gardens, kitchen appliances, preservation strategies, individual foods/food groups, and home demonstration in Virginia. In addition, the collection contains several publication from agencies in Oregon and Ohio, as well as from the Virginia Emergency Relief Administration and the War Food Administration.

The collection is arranged in four series: Series I: United States Department of Agriculture Publications, 1917-1976; Series II: Virginia Cooperative Extension Publications, 1932-1994; Series III: Virginia Home Demonstration Pamphlets, 1943-1948, n.d.; and Series IV: Other National and State Agency Publications, 1934-1944, n.d. Each series contains folder-level bibliographies of materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in three series. Series I: United States Department of Agriculture Publications, 1917-1976; Series II: Virginia Cooperative Extension Publications, 1932-1994; Series III: Virginia Home Demonstration Pamphlets, 1943-1948, n.d.; and Series IV: Other National and State Agency Publications, 1934-1944, n.d.

Series I: United States Department of Agriculture Publications, 1917-1976, includes pamphlets, bulletins, leaflets, and other materials on a number of topics. The particular emphasis is World War II-era publications relating to preservation, food economy, and food substitutions. Other publications discuss specific foods/food groups, kitchen appliances, and preservation (canning, drying, pickling, and freezing). Pamphlets and publications in this series were produce by various USDA agencies, including the Bureau of Home Economics (later the Bureau of Human Nutrition and Home Economics), the Agricultural Marketing Administration, the Extension Division, and the Agricultural Research Service.

Series II: Virginia Cooperative Extension Publications, 1932-1994, features mainly publications relating to war-time themes of food preservation, Victory and home gardening, and nutrition. Other major topics includes apples cheese.

Series III: Virginia Home Demonstration Pamphlets, n.d. contains a small collection on handouts prepared by and for home demonstration agents. Three of the publications are about apples, including the use of Virginia varieties. The other item relates to baking sugarless desserts.

Series IV: Other National and State Agency Publications, 1934-1944, n.d., includes materials from the U.S. War Administration, the Virginia Emergency Relief Administration, and Extension agencies in Georgia and Ohio. Publications cover topics including apples, school lunches, food preservation, and home gardens.
Each series is arranged in chronological order. Undated materials are at the end of each series and are arranged alphabetically by title.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Ms2001-004, Ann A. Hertzler Collection. Finding aid available online.
Ms2011-021, Janet L. Cameron Collection. Finding aid available online.

RG 26/2, Agricultural Extension Service (now Virginia Cooperative Extension Service) Records. A brief description of the materials in this University Archives record group is available online: http://spec.lib.vt.edu/archives/guide/rg26.htm.

Special Collections houses more than 300 publications by the Virginia Cooperative Extension Service. Publications may be found by searching the library's catalog, Addison, for author: Virginia Cooperative Extension Service.

controlaccess.head: Corporate Names:
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Dept. of Health and Human Services.
United States. Division of Home Economics.
